citation.article-title: Desulfurella kamchatkensis sp. nov. and Desulfurella propionica sp. nov., new sulfur-respiring thermophilic bacteria from Kamchatka thermal environments.

p.s: Description of Desulfurella kamchatkensis sp. nov.
Desulfurella kamchatkensis (kam.chat.ken'sis. L. part. originating from Kamchatka)
Cells are short rods, 1.5-2.0 x 0.5-0.8 µm, single or in pairs, motile with one polar flagellum.
Moderate thermophile growing between 40 and 70 °C, optimally at 54 °C; neutrophile with a pH optimum of 6.9-7.2.
Growth substrates: H2/C02, acetate, pyruvate, lactate, fumarate, malate, palmitate, stearate.
Does not utilize glucose, sucrose, starch, peptone, yeast extract, formate, propionate, benzoate, hexadecane, succinate, ethanol or methanol.
Growth products : H2S, CO2, G +C content of DNA: 31.6mol%.
Habitat: continental hot springs, rich in elemental sulfur and organics.
Source of isolation: ' Thermothrix thiopara' association from Pauzhetka hot spring (Kamchatka).
